page.title: 12Sparkwell children's games.
page.content: 'Swingball' is a game with a ball on a length of string which is tied to a pole. It is for two players with bats. One player stands on each side of the pole. You hit the ball backwards and forwards to each other. 'Kiss-murder' is a game where you all hide while one boy counts to three hundred. If a boy finds a girl he kisses her on the hand. If a boy finds a boy they shake hands. For 'Scramble' you need a ball or something to throw. One person has the ball and she throws the ball up towards a crowd of the others and she shouts "Scramble". The first one to catch the ball throws it up next time. Robert Reed,Michelle Hart and Elizabeth Burrell.
